change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by 2015-5-67 (6), effective September 1, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions

bcl:definition.bcl:text: aboriginal institution class has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation;
Act means the Private Training Act;
chartered professional accountant member has the same meaning as in the Chartered Professional Accountants Act;
intermittent intake model has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Private Training Regulation;
language institution class has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation;
post-program payment institution class has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation;
program outline has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Private Training Regulation;
remaining certificate term means the period that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: starts on the date this section comes into force, and

bcl:definition.bcl:text: student intake model has the same meaning as section 1 of the Private Training Regulation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an institution that is deemed under section 72 (1) of the Act to hold a registration certificate;
an institution that is deemed under section 72 (2) of the Act to hold a designation certificate;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: tuition revenue means tuition revenue within the meaning of section 2.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tuition revenue
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of this regulation, tuition revenue is the following, as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a transitioned institution that, on the date this section comes into force, was never required to submit financial statements under Bylaw 39.5.1 of the Private Career Training Institutions Agency established under the former Act, as it reads on the date this section comes into force, tuition revenue is either

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the tuition revenue set out in the pro-forma budget required under Bylaw 17.5.9 of the Private Career Training Institutions Agency established under the former Act, as it reads on the date this section comes into force, for that fiscal year, or
if

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the institution provides only programs of instruction that are not approved programs of instructions or both programs of instruction that are not approved programs of instruction and programs of instruction that require approval under the Act, and

on or before September 8, 2016, the institution submits to the registrar an estimate of the total tuition revenue in respect of approved programs of instruction the institution estimates it will earn in that fiscal year,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that total tuition revenue;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a transitioned institution that, on the date this section comes into force, has submitted, or was required to submit, financial statements for the previous fiscal year under Bylaw 39.5.1 of the Private Career Training Institutions Agency established under the former Act, as it reads on the date this section comes into force, tuition revenue is either

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the institution's total tuition revenue earned in the previous fiscal year, or

if, on or before September 8, 2016, the institution submits to the registrar the amount of the annual tuition revenue, within the meaning of section 3 (2) of the Act, reviewed by a chartered professional accountant member in good standing, that annual tuition revenue.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Calculating number of months
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of calculating the number of months in a period of time in this regulation, a month in which at least 25 days have elapsed once the period of time is concluded must be included in the calculation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Additional information required by transitioned institutions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transitioned institution must submit the following information and records to the registrar within 30 days of the date this section comes into force:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the institution's dispute resolution process;
whether the institution is in a class of certified institutions established under section 2 of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation and, if so, the institution must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specify which class, and
provide evidence that the institution is in the class specified under subparagraph (i);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a list of all the titles of the programs of instruction the institution provides.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transitioned institution must submit the following information and records in respect of programs of instruction to the registrar within 30 days of the date this section comes into force:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of each program of instruction,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the amount of tuition and related fees for the program,
the number of hours of instruction of the program,
the number of weeks of the program during which students enrolled in the institution receive instruction,
the program outline, and
the location where the institution provides, or from which the institution provides, the program of instruction;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of an approved program of instruction

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the student intake model,
if the student intake model is an intermittent intake model,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the number of intakes throughout the program, and
the maximum number of students admitted in each intake,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the maximum number of students that are admitted to the program, and
if the program includes a work experience component, a list of all of the host organizations that will provide work experience components to the institution's students.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fiscal year end on March 31, 2016
bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite section 51 (1) [reporting requirements] of the Private Training Regulation, a transitioned institution that has a fiscal year end on March 31, 2016 must submit to the registrar financial statements for the institution's previous fiscal year on or before September 30, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Program approval under former Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: A program is deemed to be an approved program of instruction if,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the date this section comes into force, the program is approved under Bylaw 35.17 of the Private Career Training Institutions Agency established under the former Act, as it reads on the date this section comes into force, and
the program is a program of instruction that requires approval under the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional fees
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 13 (h) [certified institution fees] of the Act, the transitional flat rate fees set out in sections 8 and 9 of this regulation and the transitional graduated fees set out in sections 10 to 13 of this regulation are prescribed in relation to the remaining certificate term of a transitioned institution.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional flat rate fees — fiscal year end between March 30, 2016 and September 1, 2016

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution that has a fiscal year end between March 30, 2016 and September 1, 2016.
The transitional flat rate fees that a transitioned institution must pay are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the flat rate fee determined in accordance with subsection (3), and
the flat rate fee determined in accordance with subsection (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (a), the flat rate fee is determined by multiplying the number of months in the period that starts on the date this section comes into force and ends on the date that is 7 months after the institution's fiscal year end for the 2015/2016 fiscal year by the monthly flat rate set out in column 2 of Table 2 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation opposite the institution's annual tuition revenue in column 1.

For the purposes of applying Table 2 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in subsection (3) of this section, the institution's annual tuition revenue is the institution's applicable tuition revenue.

For the purposes of subsection (2) (b), the flat rate fee is determined by multiplying the number of months in the period that starts on the date that is 7 months and one day after the institution's fiscal year end for the 2015/2016 fiscal year and ends on the date the remaining certificate term ends by the monthly flat rate set out in column 2 of Table 2 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation opposite the institution's annual tuition revenue in column 1.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional flat rate fees — fiscal year end between August 31, 2016 and September 1, 2017

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution that has a fiscal year end between August 31, 2016 and September 1, 2017 but does not apply to a transitioned institution to which section 8 applies.

The transitional flat rate fee that a transitioned institution must pay is the amount determined by multiplying the number of months in the remaining certificate term by the monthly flat rate set out in column 2 of Table 2 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation opposite the institution's annual tuition revenue in column 1.

For the purposes of applying Table 2 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in subsection (2), the institution's annual tuition revenue is the institution's applicable tuition revenue.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional graduated fees — fiscal year end between March 30, 2016 and September 1, 2016

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution that has a fiscal year end between March 30, 2016 and September 1, 2016.
Subject to sections 12 and 13, the transitional graduated fees that a transitioned institution must pay are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the graduated fee determined in accordance with subsection (3), and
the graduated fee determined in accordance with subsection (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (a), the graduated fee is determined as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the institution's tuition revenue for the 2014/2015 fiscal year;

the percentage of the institution's annual tuition revenue set out in column 3 of Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in respect of graduated fees opposite the applicable description of the institution in column 1 and the applicable number of certificate or registration years in column 2;
the number of months in the period that starts on the date this section comes into force and ends on the date that is 7 months after the date of the institution's 2015/2016 fiscal year end.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in subsection (3), the institution's annual tuition revenue is the institution's applicable tuition revenue.
For the purposes of subsection (2) (b), the graduated fee is determined as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the percentage of the institution's annual tuition revenue set out in column 3 of Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in respect of graduated fees opposite the applicable description of the institution in column 1 and the applicable number of certificate or registration years in column 2;

the number of months in the period that starts on the date that is 7 months and one day after the date of the institution's 2015/2016 fiscal year end and ends on the date that the remaining certificate term ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional graduated fees — fiscal year end between August 31, 2016 and September 1, 2017

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution that has a fiscal year end between August 31, 2016 and September 1, 2017 but does not apply to a transitioned institution to which section 10 applies.
Subject to sections 12 and 13, the graduated fee that a transitioned institution must pay is determined as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the percentage of the institution's annual tuition revenue set out in column 3 of Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in respect of graduated fees opposite the applicable description of the institution in column 1 and the applicable number of certificate or registration years in column 2;
the number of months in the remaining certificate term.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in subsection (2), the institution's annual tuition revenue is the institution's applicable tuition revenue.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional graduated fees — aboriginal institution class, language institution class and regulatory body institution class

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution in the aboriginal institution class, the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class.

Subject to subsection (3) and section 13, the transitional graduated fees that a transitioned institution in the aboriginal institution class, the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class must pay is determined in accordance with section 10 or 11, as applicable.
For the purposes of applying the formulas set out in sections 10 and 11 in subsection (2), the "GFP" is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 0.2% in relation to an institution in the aboriginal institution class;

0.2% in relation to an institution in the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class if, on the date this section comes into force, the institution has held a certificate under the Act or was registered under the former Act for less than 2 years;
0.2% in relation to an institution in the language institution class or in the regulatory body institution class if, on the date this section comes into force, the institution

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: continuously held a certificate under the Act or was registered under the former Act for 2 or more years, and
is assigned to category 1 or category 2 in a category assignment assessment under Part 5 [Transitional Category Assignment].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional graduated fees — category 3 institutions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The transitional graduated fee that a transitioned institution that is assigned to category 3 in a category assignment assessment under Part 5 [Transitional Category Assignment] must pay is determined in accordance with section 10 or 11, as applicable.
For the purposes of applying the formulas set out in sections 10 and 11 in subsection (1), the "GFP" is 1.04%.

This section does not apply to a transitioned institution in the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class if, on the date this section comes into force, the institution has held a certificate under the Act or was registered under the former Act for less than 2 years.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional payments to fund
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 22 [payments to fund] of the Act, the payments set out in this Part are prescribed in relation to the remaining certificate term of a transitioned institution.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional payments to fund — fiscal year end between March 30, 2016 and September 1, 2016

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution that has a fiscal year end between March 30, 2016 and September 1, 2016.
Subject to sections 17 to 20, a transitioned institution must pay to the fund

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount determined in accordance with subsection (3), and
the amount determined in accordance with subsection (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (a), the amount is determined as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the institution's tuition revenue for the 2014/2015 fiscal year;

the percentage of the institution's annual tuition revenue set out in column 4 of Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in respect of payments to the fund opposite the applicable description of the institution in column 1 and the applicable number of certificate or registration years in column 2;
the number of months in the period that starts on the date this section comes into force and ends on the date that is 7 months after the date of the institution's 2015/2016 fiscal year end.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in subsection (3), the institution's annual tuition revenue is the institution's applicable tuition revenue.
For the purposes of subsection (2) (b), the transitional graduated fee is determined as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the percentage of the institution's annual tuition revenue set out in column 4 of Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in respect of payments to the fund opposite the applicable description of the institution in column 1 of that table and the applicable number of certificate or registration years in column 2 of that table;

the number of months in the period that starts on the date that is 7 months and one day after the end of the institution's 2015/2016 fiscal year end and ends on the date that the remaining certificate term ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional payments to fund — fiscal year end between August 31, 2016 and September 1, 2017

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution that has a fiscal year end between August 31, 2016 and September 1, 2017 but does not apply to a transitioned institution to which section 15 applies.
Subject to sections 17 to 20, a transitioned institution must pay to the fund an amount determined as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the percentage of the institution's annual tuition revenue set out in column 4 of Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in respect of payments to the fund opposite the applicable description of the institution in column 1 and the applicable number of certificate or registration years in column 2;
the number of months in the remaining certificate term.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying Table 3 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in subsection (2), the institution's annual tuition revenue is the institution's applicable tuition revenue.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional payments to fund — specified conditions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: current ratio has the same meaning as in section 19 (1) [payments to fund — specified conditions] of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation;
debt ratio has the same meaning as in section 19 (1) of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transitioned institution must pay to the fund the amounts determined under section 15 or 16, as applicable, minus the greater of the following applicable amounts:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 5% if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the institution's most recent financial statements provided to the registrar show a debt ratio of less than 0.2, and
the institution's 3-year average current ratio is 1.2 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to an institution in the aboriginal institution class, the post-program payment institution class or the post-program payment institution class and any other class.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional payments to fund — aboriginal institution class and post-program payment institution class
bcl:section.bcl:text: A certified institution that is in the aboriginal institution class, the post-program payment institution class or the post-program payment institution class and any other class must pay to the fund $10 for the remaining certificate term.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional payments to fund — language institution class and regulatory body institution class

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a transitioned institution in the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class.

Subject to subsection (3) and section 20, a transitioned institution in the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class must pay to the fund an amount that is determined in accordance with section 15 or 16, as applicable.
For the purposes of applying the formulas set out in sections 15 and 16 in subsection (2) of this section, the "P" is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 0.35% in relation to an institution in the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class if, on the date this section comes into force, the institution has held a certificate under the Act or was registered under the former Act for less than 2 years;
0.35% in relation to an institution in the language institution class or in the regulatory body institution class if, on the date this section comes into force, the institution

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: continuously held a certificate under the Act or was registered under the former Act for 2 or more years, and
is assigned to category 1 or category 2 in a category assignment assessment under Part 5 [Transitional Category Assignment].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional payments to fund — category 3 institutions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transitioned institution that is assigned to category 3 in a category assignment assessment under Part 5 [Transitional Category Assignment] must pay to the fund an amount that is determined in accordance with section 15 or 16, as applicable.
For the purposes of applying the formulas set out in sections 15 and 16 in subsection (1), the "P" is 1%.

This section does not apply to a transitioned institution in the language institution class or the regulatory body institution class if, on the date this section comes into force, the institution has held a certificate under the Act or was registered under the former Act for less than 2 years.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Continued claims against Student Tuition Protection Fund

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, on the date this section comes into force,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a student is enrolled in a program of instruction under the former Act in relation to which the board under the former Act was authorized to make payments from the fund to the student, and
the program is not an approved program of instruction under the Act,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the student may file a claim under the Act and, subject to subsection (2) of this section, Division 2 [Student Tuition Protection Fund] of Part 3 [Consumer Protection] of the Act applies to the claim.
For the purposes of subsection (1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a student may file a claim on the grounds referred to in section 23 (1) (a) [claims against fund] of the Act only if the institution ceased operations, and
a student may file a claim on the grounds referred to in section 23 (1) (b) of the Act even if the institution is not a certified institution.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional category assignment assessment

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies for the purposes of determining the transitional graduated fees referred to in Part 3 [Fees] and the payments to the fund referred to in Part 4 [Student Tuition Protection Fund].
Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the registrar must in September 2016 and again for the purposes of sections 10 (2) (b) and 15 (2) (b)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: conduct an assessment

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with sections 32 (3), (4) and (5) and 33 to 41 of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation, of an institution that is deemed under section 72 (1) of the Act to hold a registration certificate, and

in accordance with section 42 (3), (4) and (5) of the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation, of an institution that is deemed to hold a designation certificate by section 72 (2) of the Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: assign the transitioned institution to a category.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must assign a transitioned institution in the aboriginal institution class to category 1.
The registrar must assign a transitioned institution to category 3 if, on the date this section comes into force,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the institution continuously held a certificate under the Act or was registered under the former Act for 2 years or less, or
the registrar has suspended any of the institution's certificates under the Act or the former registrar suspended the registration of the institution under the former Act within the past 2 years.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Manner and time for making payments

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The transitional fees payable and the transitional payments to the fund payable under this regulation must be paid in the form set out in this section.
Unless subsection (3) applies, the fee or payment payable under subsection (1) must be paid in the form of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a lump sum payment payable within 30 days of receiving notice from the registrar of the requirement to make the payment, or
monthly payments,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of transitional flat rate fees, in the amount set out in column 2 of Table 2 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation opposite the institution's annual tuition revenue in column 1,
in the case of transitional graduated fees, in equal monthly instalments, and
in the case of transitional payments to the fund, in equal monthly instalments

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: payable on or before the 15th day of each month following the month in which the institution receives notice from the registrar of the requirement to make the payment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a fee payable or a payment to the fund payable is determined by using a number of months in the applicable formula that is 1, 2 or 3, the fee or payment must be paid in the form of a lump sum payment payable within 30 days of receiving notice from the registrar of the requirement to make the payment.

For the purposes of applying Table 2 of the Schedule to the Fees and Student Tuition Protection Fund Regulation in subsection (2), the institution's annual tuition revenue is the institution's applicable tuition revenue.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Methods of payment

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the fees payable under this regulation, and
the payments to the fund under this regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: must be paid by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: cheque, payable to the Minister of Finance,
credit card, or
electronic funds transfer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Monthly payments under this regulation must be paid by pre-authorized debit.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Private Training Act, S.B.C. 2015, c. 5, section 67]
